channel.title: GrandExchange RESTful Service (Current Version: Alpha)
channel.description:
[url=https://github.com/Hadyn/ge]Repository[/url]
[b]Dependencies[/b]
- Ruby > 2.1.x - Bundler
[b]Changelog[/b]
[code] Alpha 0.0.1 - Added creating offer - Added getting offer by id - Added getting offers
Alpha 0.1.0 - Added offer cancelling - Added getting offers by player id - Added getting active/inactive offers by player id - Added fetching static assets - Added 404 template, index template [/code]
[b]Why would I use this?[/b]
If you're a RSPS operator who want's to provide a Grand Exchange platform to your users on a flexible service which can be integrated with your website and game then this will be useful to you. It could also be used for hobby purposes, learning purposes.
[b]Response Format[/b]
The basic response format includes the HTTP status code and if the request was successful along with any associated data. Unsuccessful requests will include a message describing the error, the HTTP request method, and the path to the requested resource.
[code] { "status" : 200, "success" : true, "data" : ... }
{ "status" : 404, "success" : false, "data" : { "error" : "Error message here", "request" : "Path/To/Request", "method" : "GET" } } [/code]
[b]How do I use this in a production setting?[/b]
[code] rake app:start RACK_ENV=production [/code]
[b]Installation[/b]
[code] git clone https://github.com/Hadyn/ge && cd ge bundle install rake db:setup [/code]
[b]Let's get it going![/b]
[code] rake app:start [/code]

item.title: GrandExchange RESTful Service (Current Version: Alpha)
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Do you really need to specify response codes in the JSON itself? Can’t you just actually send those response codes? Likewise with “success”. Wouldn’t it make more sense to just send appropriate status codes via HTTP and have the client check those?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Ashi:

What made you decide on using a REST server?

JSON RPC specification sucked. (Just was still in infancy, I could feel that and it didn’t really feel like it fit with HTTP)

Read full topic
